Can-do statement.1067: Can use auxiliary verb 'be'. ►  present continuous
Can-do statement.864: Can use the affirmative form with a limited range of regular and irregular verbs.
Can-do statement.841: Can end a 'wh-' question with a preposition, where the preposition is stranded from its complement.
Can-do statement.679: Can use the '-ing' forms of verbs as nouns, in object position, to refer to activities.
Can-do statement.231: Can use defining relative clauses with 'where' to define nouns referring to place.
Can-do statement.210: Can form interrogative clauses with an adverb in mid position, between the subject and the main verb.
Can-do statement.719: Can use past simple passive negative.
Can-do statement.541: Can use the fixed expression 'I must admit' or 'you must admit' to express concession.
Can-do statement.350: Can use determiners in hyperbole, often in informal contexts ('millions of', 'loads of', 'tons of').
Can-do statement.199: Can use imperatives to introduce a condition followed by 'and' to introduce a consequence of the condition.
Can-do statement.564: Can use the negative form 'ought not to'.

Example.1067:
I am writing to tell you what I do every day at college. 

I'm working today. 

We are going to the park.
Example.864:
Every day at college I learn new words and new things. 

I am your new neighbour. 

She plays tennis and she likes going to the swimming pool.
Example.841:
Who are you going with? 

So what are you waiting for?
Example.679:
There we did a lot of things like swimming from the beach and going shopping. 

I prefer dancing, but on Saturday I'd like to go to a jazz concert. 

I practised windsurfing and scuba diving.
Example.210:
Have you ever been to Marseille? 

What kind of books do you usually read? 

Do you still remember my best friend?
Example.719:
What is worse, the ticket price was not reduced despite the fact that I showed my student ID. 

I had to go to the hospital because my back hurt so badly, and I wasn't allowed to work for two weeks. 

I was really disappointed because a lot of things were not done. 

Some say that studying animals would be impossible, if they weren't kept in zoos ?
Example.541:
On the other hand you must admit that not all ready-made meals taste really good and often they are not as healthy as fresh ones. 

However, I must admit that I completely agree with Chris and consider the mountain road too daring to try.
Example.350:
My kitchen is absolutely cramped. I love cooking and despite the fact that I have no space, I managed to fit in a table as well as millions of cookbooks and all the necessary kitchen tools. 

I'm going to make loads of cookies this year and will give them in nice little boxes to my family and friends. 

I received tons of plastic ducks every time I had my birthday or some kind of celebration.
Example.199: See one of them and you'll want to see them all.
Example.553:
Need you ask? 

Lastly I would appreciate , as I am sure others would too, if the premises were cleaner. Need I say more?
Example.564:
Secondly, there ought not to be a division between rich and poor. 

We ought not to forget that in the last twenty years the food industry has increased the number of chemicals used in its products.

prompt.1067:

Examples:

I am writing to tell you what I do every day at college. 

I'm working today. 

We are going to the park.

prompt.679:

prompt.231:

Examples:

The city where I live is very nice and extremely charming. 

But if they are going to a place where you go every year you should go with your friends, you will have more fun.

prompt.541:

Examples:

prompt.350:

Examples:

My kitchen is absolutely cramped. I love cooking and despite the fact that I have no space, I managed to fit in a table as well as millions of cookbooks and all the necessary kitchen tools. 

I'm going to make loads of cookies this year and will give them in nice little boxes to my family and friends. 

I received tons of plastic ducks every time I had my birthday or some kind of celebration.
